titles: The scourge of civill warre. The blessing of peace. A memento very necessary; shewing the miseries and discommodities of civill-warre or the fruits and effects of blessed-peace.
notes: In verse -- "Warre, In her own kingdome scalds her very Bowels."
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
